newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: NLCF passes on tendr for 52,500T of feed wheat.
newsitem.headline: NLCF passes on tendr for 52,500T of feed wheat.

text.p: South Korea's National Livestock Co-operatives Federation said on Wednesday it passed on a tender for 52,500 tonnes of feed wheat due to high offered prices.

An NLCF official said the lowest bid for the feed wheat sourced from Australia was made by Nidera at $130.80 a tonne C&F, while the lowest bid sourced from Canada was made by Hyundai Corp, a unit of South Korea's Hyundai Group, at $139.25 a tonne, C&F.

The official said the target price for the feed wheat tender was below $130 a tonne, C&F, based on Canadian feed wheat. The target for Australian feed wheat would be some $10 a tonne lower due to its lower protein and quality.

He said the NLCF is considering changing its original plan to buy feed wheat and may substitute the wheat with corn following Tuesday's USDA corn crop report which pressured Chicago corn futures prices overnight.
On Tuesday, the USDA said the 1996 U.S. corn crop would total 9.265 billion bushels, above an average of 9.149 billion forecast by analysts'.
